instructions: 1. Muddle 8-10 Mint leaves and 1/2 oz simple syrup in a glass.
2. Add 2 oz of white rum.
3. Add 1 oz of Lime juice.
4. Fill the glass with ice and top it off with club soda.
5. Stir gently and garnish with a lime wedge and a mint sprig.
1. In a blender, combine 2 oz white rum, 3 oz coconut cream, and 4 oz pineapple juice with ice.
2. Blend until smooth.
3. Pour into a chilled glass and garnish with a pineapple slice and a maraschino cherry.
1. Rim the glass with salt.
2. In a shaker, combine 2 oz tequila, 1 oz triple sec, and 1 oz Lime juice with ice.
3. Shake well and strain into the prepared glass.
4. Garnish with a lime wheel.
1. In a shaker, combine 2 oz vodka, 1 oz triple sec, 1 oz cranberry juice, and 1/2 oz Lime juice with ice.
2. Shake well and strain into a chilled martini glass.
3. Garnish with a lime twist.
1. In a glass, muddle a sugar cube with a few dashes of Angostura bitters.
2. Add 2 oz of bourbon and a splash of simple syrup.
3. Fill the glass with ice and stir well.
4. Garnish with an orange twist and a cherry.
1. Fill a highball glass with ice.
2. Pour ginger ale over the ice.
3. Add a splash of grenadine.
4. Stir gently and garnish with a maraschino cherry.
1. In a blender, combine equal parts pineapple juice and coconut cream with crushed ice.
2. Blend until smooth and pour into a chilled glass.
3. Garnish with a pineapple wedge.
1. Rim a glass with celery salt.
2. In the glass, combine tomato juice, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, hot sauce, and black pepper.
3. Fill the glass with ice and stir well.
4. Garnish with a celery stalk and a lemon wedge.
1. In a shaker, combine 2 oz vodka, 1 oz coffee liqueur, and 1 oz freshly brewed coffee (espresso) with ice.
2. Shake well and strain into a chilled martini glass.
3. Garnish with a few coffee beans.
1. Fill a glass with ice cubes.
2. Pour 2 oz of gin over the ice.
3. Top it off with tonic water.
4. Stir gently and garnish with a lime wheel.
1. Cut a lime into wedges and place them in a glass.
2. Sprinkle 2 teaspoons of sugar over the lime wedges.
3. Muddle the lime and sugar together to release the lime juice.
4. Fill the glass with ice and pour 2 oz of cachaça over the mixture.
5. Stir well and garnish with a lime wedge.
1. Fill a copper mug with ice.
2. Pour 2 oz of vodka over the ice.
3. Top it off with ginger beer.
4. Squeeze a lime wedge into the drink and drop it in.
5. Stir gently and garnish with a lime wheel.
1. In a shaker, combine 2 oz gin, 1 oz lemon juice, and 1/2 oz simple syrup with ice.
2. Shake well and strain into a Collins glass filled with ice.
3. Top it off with soda water.
4. Garnish with a lemon slice and a cherry.
1. Fill a wine glass with ice.
2. Add 2 oz of Aperol to the glass.
3. Top it off with 3 oz of sparkling wine and a splash of soda water.
4. Stir gently and garnish with an orange wheel.
1. Fill a highball glass with ice.
2. Pour 1 oz of vodka over the ice.
3. Add 1 oz of Blue Curacao.
4. Top it off with lemonade.
5. Stir gently and garnish with a lemon wheel.
1. Muddle a handful of fresh raspberries and 1/2 oz simple syrup in a glass.
2. Add 2 oz of white rum and a squeeze of Lime juice.
3. Fill the glass with ice and top it off with club soda.
4. Stir gently and garnish with a lime wedge, a raspberry, and a mint sprig.
1. In a blender, combine 2 oz white rum, 1 oz Lime juice, 1/2 oz simple syrup, and a handful of fresh strawberries with ice.
2. Blend until smooth.
3. Pour into a chilled glass and garnish with a strawberry and a lime wheel.
1. Rim the glass with chili salt.
2. Mash the mango into a puree. Add some watter, if needed.
3. In a shaker, combine 2 oz tequila, 1 oz triple sec, 1 oz Lime juice, and 2 oz mango puree with ice.
4. Shake well and strain into the prepared glass.
5. Garnish with a mango slice.
1. In a shaker, muddle a few cucumber slices and Mint leaves with 1/2 oz simple syrup.
2. Add 2 oz of gin and 1 oz of Lime juice with ice.
3. Shake well and strain into a glass filled with ice.
4. Top it off with soda water and garnish with a cucumber ribbon, lime wedge and a mint sprig.
1. In a shaker, combine 2 oz gin, 1 oz blackberry liqueur, 3/4 oz Lemon juice, and 1/2 oz simple syrup with ice.
2. Shake well and strain into a glass filled with crushed ice.
3. Garnish with blackberries and a lemon wedge.
1. Separate the egg white from yolk. We'll only need the egg white for this recipe
2. In a shaker, combine 2 oz bourbon, 3/4 oz lemon juice, 1/2 oz simple syrup, and 1 egg white with ice.
3. Shake well to emulsify the egg white.
4. Strain into a rocks glass filled with ice.
5. Garnish with a cherry.
1. Separate the egg white from yolk. We'll only need the egg white for this recipe
2. In a shaker, combine 2 oz gin, 1 oz lemon juice, 1/2 oz simple syrup, and 1 egg white with ice.
3. Shake vigorously to froth the egg white.
4. Strain into a highball glass filled with ice.
5. Top it off with club soda and garnish with a lemon twist.
1. Separate the egg white from yolk. We'll only need the egg white for this recipe
2. In a shaker, combine 2 oz gin, 1 oz heavy cream, 1/2 oz lemon juice, 1/2 oz simple syrup, 1 egg white, and a few drops of orange flower water with ice.
3. Shake vigorously for at least a minute to create a frothy texture.
4. Strain into a highball glass without ice.
5. Top it off with club soda and garnish with a lemon slice.
1. Separate the egg yolk from white. We'll only need the egg yolk for this recipe
1. In a shaker, combine 2 oz bourbon, 1/2 oz maple syrup, and 1 egg yolk with ice.
2. Shake well to emulsify the egg yolk.
3. Strain into a rocks glass without ice.
4. Garnish with a sprinkle of grated nutmeg.
1. In a heat-resistant glass, combine 2 oz bourbon, 1 tablespoon of honey, and hot water to fill the glass halfway.
2. Stir until the honey is dissolved.
3. Squeeze the juice from a lemon wedge into the glass.
4. Add a few cloves and stir with a cinnamon.
5. Add a lemon wheel for garnish.
1. Prepare the coffee according to your preference
2. In a heat-resistant glass, combine 2 oz Irish whiskey, the hot coffee to fill the glass halfway, and 1 teaspoon of brown sugar.
3. Stir until the sugar is dissolved.
4. Top it off with a generous dollop of whipped cream.
5. Garnish with coffee beans.
1. In a saucepan, heat apple cider with a cinnamon stick, cloves, and a strip of orange peel.
2. Once hot, pour the spiced apple cider into a mug.
3. Add 2 oz of spiced rum and stir.
4. Garnish with an apple slice and star anise.
1. Prepare hot chocolate according to package instructions.
2. Stir in 2 oz of tequila, a pinch of cayenne pepper, and a dash of cinnamon.
3. Pour into a mug and top with whipped cream and chocolate shavings.
1. In a heat-resistant glass, combine 2 oz dark rum, hot water to fill the glass halfway, and 1 tablespoon of butter.
2. Stir until the butter is melted.
3. Add 1 teaspoon of brown sugar, a pinch of cinnamon, and a pinch of nutmeg. Stir well.
4. Garnish with a cinnamon stick.
1. In a glass, muddle Mint leaves and lime wedges with 1 oz simple syrup.
2. Fill the glass with ice and top it off with club soda.
3. Stir gently and garnish with a mint sprig.
1. In a glass, combine cucumber slices and mint leaves.
2. Fill the glass with ice and pour in lemonade and sparkling water.
3. Stir gently and garnish with a lemon slice and mint sprig.
1. In a blender, combine mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries), lemonade, and 1 oz agave syrup with ice.
2. Blend until smooth.
3. Pour into a glass and garnish with mixed berries.
1. In a glass, combine equal parts pineapple juice and ginger syrup.
2. Fill the glass with ice and top it off with sparkling water.
3. Stir gently and garnish with a pineapple wedge, candied ginger and a star anise.
1. In a shaker, combine equal parts orange juice, grapefruit juice, and lime juice with 1 oz agave syrup and ice.
2. Shake well and strain into a glass filled with ice.
3. Garnish with citrus slices.
1. In a glass filled with ice, combine 2 oz vodka and 1 oz coffee liqueur.
2. Gently pour 1 oz of heavy cream over the back of a spoon to create a layered effect.
3. Garnish with a small amount of whipped heavy cream and a star anise.
1. In a glass filled with ice, combine 2 oz vodka, 1 oz coffee liqueur, and 2 oz chai tea concentrate.
2. Gently pour 1 oz of heavy cream over the back of a spoon to create a layered effect.
3. Garnish with a cinnamon stick and a star anise.
1. Mash the strawberries into a puree. Add some watter, if needed.
2. In a shaker, combine 2 oz dark rum, 2 oz strawberry puree, 4 oz whole milk, and 1/2 oz simple syrup with ice.
3. Shake well and strain into a glass filled with ice.
4. Garnish with fresh strawberries.
1. Mash the mango into a puree. Add some watter, if needed.
2. In a shaker, combine 2 oz vodka, 2 oz mango puree, 1 oz Greek yogurt, and 1/2 oz simple syrup with ice.
3. Shake well and strain into a chilled martini glass.
4. Garnish with a mango slice.
1. In a mixing glass, muddle a strip of crispy bacon.
2. Add 2 oz bourbon, 1/2 oz maple syrup, and a dash of bacon-infused bitters.
3. Stir well with ice and strain into a rocks glass with a large ice cube.
4. Express the oils from an orange peel over the drink and use it as a garnish along with a crispy bacon strip.
1. Bring the wasabi beans and simple syrup to a boil to create an infused syrup.
2. In a shaker, combine 2 oz vodka, 1 oz sake, and 1/2 oz wasabi-infused simple syrup with ice.
3. Shake well and strain into a chilled martini glass.
4. Garnish with a lime twist and wasabi peas.
1. Blend the cucumber with water and then strain it to extract the juice.
2. In a glass, combine 2 oz gin, 3 oz cucumber juice, and 1 oz basil syrup.
3. Fill the glass with ice and top it off with sparkling water.
4. Stir gently and garnish with a cucumber ribbon and fresh basil leaves.
1. Bring the saffron and simple syrup to a boil to create an infused syrup.
2. In a shaker, muddle a few fresh sage leaves.
3. Add 2 oz gin, 3/4 oz lemon juice, and 1/2 oz saffron-infused simple syrup with ice.
4. Shake well and strain into a rocks glass filled with ice.
5. Garnish with a sage sprig.
1. In a shaker, muddle a handful of mixed berries (blueberries, raspberries, strawberries).
2. Add 2 oz vodka and 1 oz balsamic vinegar reduction with ice.
3. Shake well and strain into a highball glass filled with ice.
4. Top it off with club soda and garnish with a balsamic-glazed berry skewer.
1. In a shaker, combine 1 oz white rum, 1 oz dark rum, 1/2 oz orange liqueur, 1/2 oz orgeat syrup, and 3/4 oz lime juice with ice.
2. Shake well and strain into a rocks glass filled with crushed ice.
3. Garnish with a mint sprig and a lime wheel.
1. Separate the egg white from yolk. We'll only need the egg white for this recipe
2. In a shaker, combine 2 oz pisco, 3/4 oz lemon juice, 1/2 oz simple syrup, and 1 egg white without ice.
3. Dry shake to emulsify the egg white, then add ice and shake again.
4. Strain into a chilled coupe glass.
5. Garnish with a swirl of Angostura bitters on top.
1. Fill a highball glass with ice.
2. Pour 2 oz dark rum over the ice.
3. Top it off with ginger beer.
4. Stir gently and garnish with a lime wheel.
1. In a shaker, combine 2 oz gin, 3/4 oz lemon juice, and 1/2 oz simple syrup with ice.
2. Shake well and strain into a chilled champagne flute.
3. Top it off with sparkling wine and stir gently.
4. Garnish with a lemon twist.
1. In a shaker, combine 2 oz white rum, 3/4 oz lime juice, and 1/2 oz simple syrup with ice.
2. Shake well and strain into a chilled coupe glass.
3. Garnish with a lime wheel.
1. In a shaker, combine equal parts gin, Cointreau, Lillet Blanc, and lemon juice with ice.
2. Shake well and strain into a chilled absinthe-rinsed glass.
3. Garnish with an orange twist.
1. Fill a rocks glass with ice.
2. Pour 1 oz Campari and 1 oz sweet vermouth over the ice.
3. Top it off with sparkling wine.
4. Stir gently and garnish with an orange slice.
1. In a mixing glass, combine 1 1/2 oz bourbon, 1 oz sweet vermouth, and 1 oz Campari with ice.
2. Stir well and strain into a rocks glass filled with ice.
3. Express the oils from an orange twist over the drink and use it as a garnish.
1. In a shaker, combine 2 oz gin, 1/2 oz maraschino liqueur, 1/4 oz crème de violette, and 3/4 oz lemon juice with ice.
2. Shake well and strain into a chilled martini glass.
3. Garnish with a maraschino cherry.
1. In a pot, combine a bottle of red wine with orange slices, cloves, cinnamon sticks, star anise, and brown sugar to taste.
2. Heat gently, avoiding boiling.
3. Once heated, strain into mugs.
4. Garnish with an orange slice and a cinnamon stick.
1. In a pitcher, combine a bottle of white wine, 1/4 cup peach schnapps, 1/4 cup triple sec, and 1 cup of pineapple juice.
2. Add a mix of sliced peaches, grapes, and berries.
3. Stir well and refrigerate for a few hours.
4. Serve over ice and garnish with Mint leaves.
1. In a pitcher, combine a bottle of red wine, 1/4 cup brandy, 1/4 cup orange liqueur, and 1 cup of orange juice.
2. Add a mix of sliced oranges, berries, and apples.
3. Stir well and refrigerate for a few hours.
4. Serve over ice and garnish with orange slices.
1. Rim a highball glass with salt.
2. In the glass, combine 2 oz tequila, 3 oz grapefruit soda, 1/2 oz lime juice, and 1/2 oz simple syrup.
3. Stir well and fill the glass with ice.
4. Garnish with a grapefruit wedge.
1. In a large pitcher, combine a bottle of white wine, 1 cup of sparkling water, and 1/4 cup brandy.
2. Add a mix of sliced apples, peaches, and berries.
3. Stir gently and refrigerate for a few hours.
4. Serve over ice and garnish with mint leaves.
1. In a shaker, combine 2 oz gin, 3/4 oz lime juice, and 1/2 oz simple syrup with ice.
2. Shake well and strain into a chilled martini glass.
3. Garnish with a lime wheel.
1. In a mixing glass, combine 2 oz Scotch whisky, 1 oz sweet vermouth, and a few dashes of Angostura bitters with ice.
2. Stir well and strain into a chilled martini glass.
3. Garnish with a maraschino cherry.
1. In a shaker, combine 1 1/2 oz gin, 1/2 oz cherry brandy, 1/4 oz Benedictine, 1 oz pineapple juice, 1/4 oz grenadine, and 1/2 oz lime juice with ice.
2. Shake well and strain into a highball glass filled with ice.
3. Top it off with club soda and stir gently.
4. Garnish with a pineapple slice and a maraschino cherry.
1. Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes.
2. Pour 2 1/2 oz of gin into the mixing glass.
3. Add 1/2 oz of dry vermouth.
4. Stir well until the mixture is well-chilled.
5. Strain the mixture into a chilled martini glass.
6. Garnish with a lemon twist or an olive.
1. Fill a mixing glass with ice cubes.
2. Pour 1 oz of gin into the mixing glass.
3. Add 1 oz of Campari.
4. Add 1 oz of sweet vermouth.
5. Stir well to combine and chill the ingredients.
6. Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with ice.
7. Garnish with an orange twist.
1. In a mixing glass, combine 2 oz of rye whiskey.
2. Add 1 oz of sweet vermouth.
3. Add 2-3 dashes of Angostura bitters.
4. Fill the mixing glass with ice and stir well.
5. Strain the mixture into a chilled martini glass.
6. Garnish with a maraschino cherry.
1. Separate the egg white from yolk. We'll only need the egg white for this recipe
2. In a shaker, combine 2 oz bourbon, 3/4 oz simple syrup, 3/4 oz Lemon juice and 1 egg white.
3. Dry shake (without ice) for 10-15 seconds to emulsify the egg white.
4. Add ice to the shaker and shake again for 10-15 seconds.
5. Strain the mixture into a rocks glass filled with ice.
6. Garnish with a lemon slice and a cherry.
1. Rinse a chilled glass with a small amount of absinthe, coating the glass, and discard the excess.
2. In a separate mixing glass, combine 2 oz rye whiskey, 1/4 oz simple syrup, and a few dashes of Peychaud's bitters with ice.
3. Stir well and strain into the prepared glass.
4. Express the oils from a lemon peel over the drink and use it as a garnish.
1. Blend peaches into a puree. Add some water, if needed.
2. In a chilled champagne flute, add 2 oz of the peach puree.
3. Slowly pour 4 oz of sparkling wine and gently stir to combine.
4. Garnish with a white peach slice.
1. In a silver or pewter cup, muddle 8-10 Mint leaves and 1/2 oz simple syrup.
2. Add 2 1/2 oz bourbon.
3. Fill the cup with crushed ice and stir well.
4. Garnish with fresh mint sprigs.
1. In a shaker, combine 1/2 oz vodka, 1/2 oz tequila, 1/2 oz white rum, 1/2 oz gin, 1/2 oz triple sec, 3/4 oz simple syrup, and 1 oz lemon juice.
2. Shake well and strain into a highball glass filled with ice.
3. Top it off with cola.
4. Garnish with a lemon wedge.
1. In a shaker, combine 1 1/2 oz vodka, 1/2 oz raspberry liqueur, and 2 oz pineapple juice with ice.
2. Shake well and strain into a chilled martini glass.
3. Garnish with a raspberry.
1. In a mixing glass, combine 1 1/2 oz cognac and 3/4 oz amaretto with ice.
2. Stir well and strain into a rocks glass filled with ice.
1. In a highball glass, combine 1 1/2 oz vodka, 4 oz cranberry juice, and 1 oz grapefruit juice.
2. Fill the glass with ice and stir well.
3. Garnish with a lime wedge.
1. In a shaker, combine 2 oz dark rum, 2 oz white rum, 2 oz passion fruit juice, 3/4 oz orange juice, 1/2 oz lime juice, 1 oz simple syrup, and 3/4 oz grenadine with ice.
2. Shake well and strain into a hurricane glass filled with ice.
3. Garnish with an orange slice and a cherry.
1. In a highball glass, combine 2 oz tequila and 4 oz orange juice with ice.
2. Slowly pour 1 oz grenadine over the back of a spoon or by drizzling it down the side of the glass, allowing it to settle at the bottom.
3. Do not stir. Let the grenadine rise to create a sunrise effect.
4. Garnish with an orange slice and a cherry.
1. In a shaker, combine 1 1/2 oz brandy, 1 oz dark crème de cacao, and 1 oz heavy cream with ice.
2. Shake well and strain into a chilled martini glass.
3. Garnish with grated nutmeg on top.
1. Fill a highball glass with ice.
2. Pour 2 oz white rum over the ice.
3. Top it off with cola.
4. Stir gently and garnish with a lime wedge.
1. Fill a rocks glass with ice.
2. Pour 2 oz vodka over the ice.
3. Add 1/2 oz Amaretto.
4. Stir gently.
5. Garnish with a strip of orange peel.
1. Fill a highball glass with ice.
2. Pour 1 1/2 oz vodka over the ice.
3. Add 4 oz orange juice.
4. Float 1/2 oz Galliano on top by pouring it over the back of a spoon or by drizzling it over the drink.
5. Stir gently.
6. Garnish with an orange slice.
1. In a mixing glass, add 2 oz gin.
2. Add 3-4 dashes of Angostura bitters.
3. Fill the glass with ice.
4. Stir well for about 30 seconds.
5. Strain into a chilled glass.
6. Garnish with a lemon twist.
1. In a highball glass, add 1 1/2 oz vodka.
2. Fill the glass with ice.
3. Pour 4 oz of orange juice over the ice.
4. Stir gently.
5. Garnish with an orange wedge.
1. In a shaker, combine 2 oz gin, 3/4 oz simple syrup, and 1 oz lemon juice with ice.
2. Shake well and strain into a Collins glass filled with ice.
3. Top it off with club soda.
4. Stir gently and garnish with a lemon slice and a cherry.
1. In a mixing glass, combine 2 1/2 oz gin and 1/2 oz dry vermouth with ice.
2. Stir well and strain into a chilled martini glass.
3. Garnish with a pickled onion.
1. Fill a rocks glass with ice.
2. Pour 2 oz vodka over the ice.
3. Add 1 oz coffee liqueur.
4. Stir gently.
5. Garnish with a single maraschino cherry.
1. In a champagne flute, pour 2 oz of chilled sparkling wine.
2. Top it off with 2 oz of chilled orange juice.
3. Stir gently and garnish with an orange wedge
1. In a shaker, combine 2 oz dark rum, 4 oz pineapple juice, 1 oz orange juice, and 1 oz coconut cream with ice.
2. Shake well and strain into a highball glass filled with ice.
3. Garnish with an orange wedge and a pineapple wedge.
1. In a shaker, combine 2 oz dark rum, 1 oz orange juice, 1 oz pineapple juice, 1/2 oz grenadine, 1/2 oz simple syrup, and a few dashes of Angostura bitters with ice.
2. Shake well and strain into a highball glass filled with ice.
3. Garnish with an orange slice and a cherry.
1. Rim a highball glass with salt.
2. In the glass, combine 2 oz vodka and 4 oz grapefruit juice.
3. Stir well and fill the glass with ice.
4. Garnish with a salt rim and a grapefruit wedge.
1. In a highball glass, fill it with ice.
2. Pour 2 oz Pimm's No. 1 over the ice.
3. Add 4 oz lemonade.
4. Garnish with cucumber slices, mint leaves, strawberries, and orange slices.
1. Scoop the flesh of the passion fruit out into a strainer and push it with a spoon to have a passion fruit puree
2. In a shaker, combine 2 oz vanilla vodka, 1 oz passion fruit liqueur, 1 oz passion fruit puree, and 1/2 oz simple syrup with ice.
3. Shake well and strain into a martini glass.
4. Garnish with half a passion fruit and serve a shot of sparkling wine on the side.
1. In a shaker, combine equal parts orange juice, pineapple juice, and lemon juice.
2. Add 1/2 oz of simple syrup.
3. Shake well and strain into a chilled highball glass filled with ice.
4. Top it off with soda water and stir gently.
5. Garnish with a pineapple wedge and an orange wedge
1. In a glass, muddle a handful of blueberries with 1 oz of lemon juice.
2. Add 1/2 oz of simple syrup and stir well.
3. Fill the glass with ice and top it off with club soda.
4. Garnish with a lemon slice and a few blueberries.
1. In a shaker, combine 2 oz apple juice, 1/2 oz ginger syrup, and 1/2 oz lime juice with ice.
2. Shake well and strain into a chilled glass.
3. Top it off with sparkling water.
4. Garnish with a Maraschino cherry.
1. Brew a cup of black tea and let it cool.
2. In a glass, combine the cooled black tea with 1 oz peach syrup and 1/2 oz lemon juice.
3. Add fresh basil leaves and stir well.
4. Fill the glass with ice and garnish with a basil sprig.
1. In a glass, muddle fresh pineapple chunks and Mint leaves.
2. Add 1 oz lime juice and 1/2 oz simple syrup.
3. Fill the glass with ice and top it off with sparkling water.
4. Stir gently and garnish with a pineapple wedge, a lime wedge and a mint sprig.
1. In a large pitcher, combine equal parts (1 cup each) red grape juice, apple juice, and orange juice.
2. Add sliced oranges, berries, and apple slices.
3. Top it off with sparkling water.
4. Stir gently and refrigerate for a few hours.
5. Serve over ice.
6. Garnish with an orange slice, a strawberry, and a mint sprig.
1. In a saucepan, bring 1 cup of water to a boil and steep 2 chai tea bags for 5 minutes.
2. In another saucepan, heat 1 cup of whole milk, 2 tablespoons of honey, 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, 2 ounces of whiskey, 2 cinnamon sticks, and 1 star anise. Do not boil.
3. Combine the chai tea and the milk mixture.
4. Strain into mugs and discard the tea bags and spices.
5. Garnish with a cinnamon stick.
1. Steep 2 peppermint tea bags in 1 cup of boiling water for 5 minutes.
2. In a separate mug, prepare hot chocolate with your preferred mix.
3. Add 1 ounce of peppermint schnapps to the hot chocolate and stir.
4. Pour the peppermint tea into the chocolate mixture and stir.
5. Top with whipped cream and crushed peppermint candy.
1. In a heatproof bowl, combine 1 cup dark rum, 2 cups boiling water, and honey to taste.
2. Add 1/4 cup Lemon juice and stir well.
3. Drop in a cinnamon stick, a few cloves, and a pinch of nutmeg.
4. Let it steep for 5-10 minutes.
5. Pour into mugs, and garnish with a lemon slice and a cinnamon stick.
1. Separate the egg white from yolk. We'll only need the egg white for this recipe
2. In a shaker, combine 1 1/2 oz amaretto, 1 oz bourbon, 3/4 oz simple syrup, 1 oz Lemon juice, and 1 egg white.
3. Dry shake (shake without ice) to emulsify the egg white.
4. Add ice and shake again to chill.
5. Strain into a rocks glass filled with ice.
6. Garnish with a lemon twist and a cherry.
1. In a shaker, combine 2 oz cranberry juice, 1 oz lime juice, 1 oz orange juice, and 1/2 oz simple syrup with ice.
2. Shake well and strain into a chilled martini glass.
3. Add a twist of orange zest over the drink as a garnish.
1. Separate the egg white from yolk. We'll only need the egg white for this recipe
2. In a shaker, combine 2 oz gin, 1/2 oz triple sec, 1/2 oz orange marmalade, 3/4 oz Lemon juice, and 1 egg white with ice.
3. Dry shake (shake without ice) to emulsify the egg white.
4. Add ice and shake again to chill.
5. Strain into a chilled martini glass.
6. Garnish with an orange twist.
1. Rim a martini glass with melted chocolate and crushed almonds
2. In a shaker, combine 2 oz coconut vodka, 1 oz chocolate liqueur, 1/2 oz amaretto, and 1 oz coconut cream with ice.
2. Shake well and strain into a chilled martini glass.
1. In a glass, combine 1 1/2 oz Irish whiskey and 3/4 oz hazelnut liqueur.
2. Add heavy cream to your liking.
3. Stir gently and garnish with crushed hazelnuts.
1. Rim a glass with celery salt.
2. In the glass, combine 2 oz vodka, 4 oz tomato juice, 1/2 oz lemon juice, a dash of Worcestershire sauce, hot sauce, celery salt, and black pepper to taste.
3. Fill the glass with ice and stir well.
4. Garnish with a celery stalk, lemon wedge and olives.
